noun.description: Guidance or recommendations offered with regard to prudent future action.
examples: she visited the island on her doctor's advice
he took my advice and put his house up for sale

noun.description: A formal notice of a financial transaction.

examples: the want of fresh advices from Europe

phrases: he should take advice from his accountant
The two critical ingredients to the balance between giving advice and taking advice are talent and respect.
Who is Bush supposed to take advice from on energy policy?
Then I take advice from experts and they confuse me even further.
As a party we are here to serve people, to give advice and assistance and to take advice as well.
origin: Middle English: from Old French avis, based on Latin ad to + visum, past participle of videre to see. The original sense was way of looking at something, judgement, hence later an opinion given.
